verifications.original_issue: Stop signal not checked during classification phase
verifications.verification: Classification now processes in batches of 50 (CLASSIFICATION_BATCH_SIZE = 50). Stop signal checked via should_stop() before each batch at lines 427-431 and 610-614. This allows graceful exit mid-classification without waiting for all tasks to complete.

_TERMINAL_STATES defined at line 32. _cleanup_terminal_runs() implemented at lines 35-39, removes all completed/failed/stopped entries. Called at start of new run (line 166). Entries no longer accumulate unboundedly.

analysis.r1_fix_quality: Good implementation. Batching allows stop checks without cancelling individual API calls. Batch size of 50 is reasonable - large enough for efficiency, small enough for responsiveness.
analysis.r2_fix_quality: Clean implementation. Terminal states properly defined as constant. Cleanup happens on new run start, which prevents leak while allowing status queries on recently-completed runs.
analysis.potential_concerns: Minor: R3-R5 from Round 1 remain unfixed (conversations_filtered always 0, polling interval recreation, status cleared immediately). These are lower priority and acceptable for merge.
